item.title: Like bike blocks entire pavement, 3rd October
item.description:

item.title: Leafing not completed., 3rd October
item.description:
Dear Council/Street Cleaning department, I recently noticed road sweepers cleaning along Tunnel Avenue, but as usual, Mercers Close has once again been overlooked. Our communal gardens and side roads are also not being cleaned regularly. Regards Mercers Close This should be part of the normal street-cleaning schedule and should not depend on residents having to raise repeated complaints. Mercers Close is not classed as an A–B grade area, but this should not mean it is neglected entirely. I would appreciate it if you could review the cleaning schedule and ensure that Mercers Close, including its communal gardens and side roads, is properly maintained going forward. Yours sincerely, [Your Name]

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harriott Close, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lightining, 3rd October
item.description:

item.title: Slippery surface, 3rd October
item.description:
This part of the pavement is extremely slippery when went. Since it also goes up the hill, it poses serious risk to pedestrians. Especially elderly and those with mobility issues. It has been witnessed on many occasions people slipping and falling there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westwood Lane, Blackfen, London
